page.title: 10Darick Plastics Ltd. Colwall
page.content: Making use of a building that was once a fruit cannery, a firm called Darick Plastics Ltd. set up in Colwall some 12 years ago. Employing a workforce of 19, they manufacture reinforced plastic mouldings for use in industry. The plastic is reinforced with spun glass. A major product is large water-proof containers for delicate instruments which are ordered by the electricity boards, and water boards etc. A good market has been established in the Middle East, where despite dry weather, instrument housings made of metal corrode quickly. Another product is a deflector used on large lorry cabs to improve aero-dynamics and thus reduce fuel costs. A modern type of hut is also manufactured in which paint is incorporated with the plastic to reduce maintenance costs.
